alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Brown and southwestern Bartholomew Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Nashville, or 10 miles west of Columbus, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Brown and southwestern Bartholomew Counties, including the following locations... Gnaw Bone and Stone Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
